2.long: Punt was blocked. A blocked punt is a punt that is touched behind the line of scrimmage, and is recovered, or goes out of bounds, behind the line of scrimmage. If the impetus of the punt takes it beyond the line of scrimmage, it is not a blocked punt.

3.long: A first down or TD occurred due to a rush.

4.long: A first down or TD occurred due to a pass.

5.long: A first down or TD occurred due to a penalty. A play can have a first down from a pass or rush and from a penalty.

6.long: 3rd down play resulted in a first down or touchdown.

7.long: 3rd down play did not result in a first down or touchdown.

8.long: 4th down play resulted in a first down or touchdown.

9.long: 4th down play did not result in a first down or touchdown.

10.long: Rushing yards and credit for a rushing attempt.

11.long: Rushing yards and credit for a rushing attempt where the result of the play was a touchdown.

12.long: Rushing yards with no rushing attempt. This will occur when the initial runner laterals to a second runner, and the second runner possesses the lateral beyond the line of scrimmage. Both players get rushing yards, but only the first player gets a rushing attempt.

13.long: Rushing yards and no rushing attempt, where the result of the play was a touchdown. (See id 12.)

15.long: Passing yards and a pass attempt completed.

16.long: Passing yards and a pass attempt completed that resulted in a touchdown.

19.long: Pass attempt that resulted in an interception.

20.long: Number of yards lost on a pass play that resulted in a sack.

22.long: Same as previous (21), except when the play results in a touchdown.

23.long: Pass reception yards, no pass reception. This will occur when the pass receiver laterals to a teammate. The teammate gets pass reception yards, but no credit for a pass reception.

24.desc: Pass reception yards, TD, No reception
24.long: Same as previous (23), except when the play results in a touchdown.

26.long: Same as previous (25), except when the play results in a touchdown.

27.long: Interception yards, with no credit for an interception. This will occur when the player who intercepted the pass laterals to a teammate. The teammate gets interception return yards, but no credit for a pass interception.

28.long: Same as previous (27), except when the play results in a touchdown.

29.long: Punt and length of the punt. This stat is not used if the punt results in a touchback; or the punt is received in the endzone and run out; or the punt is blocked. This stat is used exclusively of the PU_EZ, PU_TB and PU_BK stats.

30.long: This stat is recorded when the punt return ended inside the opponent's 20 yard line. This is not counted as a punt or towards punting yards. This stat is used solely to calculate "inside 20" stats. This stat is used in addition to either a PU or PU_EZ stat.

31.long: SuperStat records this stat when the punt is received in the endzone, and then run out of the endzone. If the play ends in the endzone for a touchback, the stat is not recorded. This stat is used exclusively of the PU, PU_TB and PU_BK stats.

32.long: Punt and length of the punt when the play results in a touchback. This stat is used exclusively of the PU, PU_EZ and PU_BK stats.

34.long: Same as previous (33), except when the play results in a touchdown.

35.long: Punt return yards with no credit for a punt return. This will occur when the player who received the punt laterals to a teammate. The teammate gets punt return yards, but no credit for a return.

36.desc: Punt return yards, TD, No return
36.long: Same as previous (35), except when the play results in a touchdown.

37.long: Punt went out of bounds, no return on the play.

38.long: Punt was downed by kicking team, no return on the play. The player column this stat will always be NULL.

39.long: Punt resulted in a fair catch.

40.long: Punt resulted in a touchback. This is the receiving team's version of code 1504/28 (32) above. Both are needed for stat calculations, especially in season cumulative analysis.

42.long: Kickoff and length of kick, where return ended inside opponent's 20 yard line. This is not counted as a kick or towards kicking yards. This code is used solely to calculate "inside 20" stats. used in addition to a 1701 code.

43.long: SuperStat records this stat when the kickoff is received in the endzone, and then run out of the endzone. If the play ends in the endzone for a touchback, the stat is not recorded. Compare to "Punt into endzone."

46.long: Same as previous (45), except when the play results in a touchdown.

47.long: Kickoff yards with no return. This will occur when the player who is credited with the return laterals to a teammate. The teammate gets kickoff return yards, but no credit for a kickoff return.

48.desc: Kickoff return yards, TD, No return
48.long: Same as previous (47), except when the play results in a touchdown.

49.long: Kicked ball went out of bounds.

50.long: Kick resulted in a fair catch (no return).

51.long: Kick resulted in a touchback. A touchback implies that there is no return.

52.long: Player fumbled the ball, fumble was forced by another player.

53.long: Player fumbled the ball, fumble was not forced by another player.

54.long: Player fumbled the ball, and the ball went out of bounds.

55.long: Yardage gained/lost by a player after he recovered a fumble by his own team.

56.long: Same as previous (55), except when the play results in a touchdown.

57.long: If a player recovered a fumble by his own team, then lateraled to a teammate, the yardage gained/lost by teammate would be recorded with this stat.

58.desc: Own recovery yards, TD, No recovery
58.long: Same as previous (57), except when the play results in a touchdown.

59.long: Yardage gained/lost by a player after he recovered a fumble by the opposing team.

60.long: Same as previous (59), except when the play results in a touchdown.

61.long: If a player recovered a fumble by the opposing team, then lateraled to a teammate, the yardage gained/lost by the teammate would be recorded with this stat.

62.desc: Opponent recovery yards, TD, No recovery
62.long: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.

63.long: This is sort of a catch-all for yardage that doesn't fall into any other category. According to Elias, it does not include loose ball yardage. Examples are yardage on missed field goal, blocked punt. This stat is not used to "balance the books."

64.long: Same as previous (63), except when the play results in a touchdown.

69.long: The length of a missed field goal.

70.long: The length of a successful field goal.

71.long: The length of an attempted field goal that was blocked. Unlike a punt, a field goal is statistically blocked even if the ball does go beyond the line of scrimmage.

72.long: Extra point good. SuperStat uses one code for both successful and unsuccessful extra points. I think it might be better to use 2 codes.

74.long: Extra point blocked. Exclusive of the extra point failed stat.

75.long: Extra points by run good (old version has 0/1 in yards for failed/good).

77.long: Extra points by pass good (old version has 0/1 in yards for failed/good).

79.long: Tackle with no assists. Note: There are no official defensive statistics except for sacks.

80.long: Tackle with one or more assists.

84.long: Sack split equally between two players.

85.long: Incomplete pass was due primarily to the player's action.

89.long: Tackle that resulted in a safety. This is in addition to a tackle.

95.long: Tackled for a loss (TFL) is an offensive stat. A team is charged with a TFL if its rush ends behind the line of scrimmage, and at least one defensive player is credited with ending the rush with a tackle, or tackle assist. The stat will contain yardage.

102.long: SuperStat didn't have this code. A kickoff is "downed" when touched by an offensive player within the 10 yard free zone, and the ball is awarded to the receivers at the spot of the touch.

103.long: This stat will be used when the passer fumbles, then recovers, then laterals. The receiver of the lateral gets sack yardage but no sack.

107.long: Direct recovery of own kickoff, whether or not the kickoff is onside

108.long: Direct recovery in endzone of own kickoff, whether or not the kickoff is onside.

110.long: Player knocked the quarterback to the ground, quarterback was not the ball carrier. Not available for games before 2006 season.

111.long: Length of the pass, not including the yards gained by the receiver after the catch. Unofficial stat. Not available for games before 2006 season.

112.long: Length of the pass, if it would have been a completion.Unofficial stat. Not available for games before 2006 season.

113.long: Yardage from where the ball was caught until the player's action was over. Unofficial stat. Not available for games before 2006 season.

115.long: Player was the target of a pass attempt. Unofficial stat. Not available for games before 2009 season.

120.long: Player tackled the runner behind the line of scrimmage. Play must have ended, player must have received a tackle stat, has to be an offensive player tackled. Unofficial stat. Not available for games before 2008 season.

410.long: Kickoff and length of kick. Includes end zone yards for all kicks into the end zone, including kickoffs ending in a touchback.
